column2: ENGLISH
Black Network

The Zhentarim, also known as the Black Network, is an evil organization intent on dominating the land from the Moonsea to the Sword Coast North. It's a secret society, but for years the Zhents have operated openly in the Moonsea area. The Black Network has spies everywhere: anyone could be a Zhentarim, and some of them want to rule every town and steading between Shou Lung and Evermeet.
The Black Network was founded by the dark wizard Manshoon. Leadership over the Zhentarim is highly coveted by all its members.
Wolf
Viper
Ardragon
Dread Lady
Wolf
Viper
Ardragon
Dread Lord
Network Power
Ruthless Taxation
By using a small portion of your power, you can confiscate your subjects' wealth for yourself. Kind, honest and charitable rulers might face personal consequences for this action.
Enables you to §Gright-click§! on a county title, in order to steal wealth from the local peasantry.
Discount Mercenaries
You can spend a minor portion of your power and a little gold to hire a small but capable mercenary band. Your society is notorious for employing bands of evil humanoids and monsters.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu to employ a small mercenary army for a cheap price.
Employ Cunning Mercenary
You can spend some of your power to gain the services of a skilled mercenary, well versed in the arts of war and intrigue.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu, allowing you to gain the services of a skilled mercenary.
Establish Trade Route
You can spend a large amount of your power to embark on an adventure, that might eventually lead to great profits and the creation of a new trade route.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu, allowing you to create a new and profitable trade route.
Scheme for Leadership
You can spend a large amount of your power to obtain a claim on the Zhentarim title. You'll be able to align yourself with the Banite or Cyricist faction, or create a new evil faction of your own.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu. A Dread Lord of the Black Network can try to seize leadership of the Zhentarim.
Become a Zhentarim Tributary
By entering a tributary relationship with the Zhentarim, you'll be paying 20% of your monthly income to them, but in return you will be allied. That would surely please the Black Network.
Enables a decision in the §YIntrigue§! menu. You can pledge your loyalty as tributary to the Grandmaster of the Zhentarim.
So, you want to join the Black Network. Serve us well, and you'll be greatly rewarded, because the entire world will serve us, eventually. Cross us, and you won't live long enough to regret it. Deal?
Yes, master.
Er, I think I've made a mistake.
Wolves are fresh initiates of the Black Network.
Vipers are reliable spies, entrusted with a degree of extra information.
Ardragons have enough power and contacts to be important players in the Network. They are often watched with suspicion by their superiors.
Dread Lords are the real power behind the Black Network, often competing against one another and scheming for leadership of the organization.

Wealth keeps flowing through one of my provinces. The peasants already have adequate food and lodging, what do they need more coin for? As a powerful and responsible ruler, I should appropriate all of that gold, before it gets spent on something... frivolous.
Let's proceed.
On second thought, not a good idea.
There's always more than one way to skin a cat. I could simply take the gold whenever I want through force, but would a different method be more appropriate?
Some minor tax concessions for the next few years should placate them.
Ugh, just take the gold.
Make a deal with the local thieves.
It's happening. My position inside the Black Network is extremely strong, and I can finally stake a claim to the Zhentarim title. Who should align myself with, though?
The Church of Bane has many allies and a strong position.
Praise the Dark Sun, our lord Cyric!
Wait, I might be making a terrible mistake here.
I will carve my own path.

High ranking members of the Black Network have been questioning your soft leadership for a while now. More and more of them have distanced themselves from you, and it's now clear that you no longer hold any authority over the Zhentarim organization.
Maybe it's for the best, they're evil people.

Your marshal comes to see you one afternoon. Apparently, many Zhentarim merchants are reporting a new, extremely convenient trade route near your realm. The route would be highly profitable, but it seems to be infested by monsters and other unpleasantries.
Let us organize a raiding party.
I have no time for this.

Adventuring in the wilderness, hunting for monsters and bandits, is never easy, and rarely cheap. Our raiding party will need supplies, beasts of burden and a good wage, or this expedition will fail before it even begins.
Of course.
We can pillage as we go.
No, this is far too expensive.

Adventuring on the high seas, hunting for monsters and pirates, is never easy, and rarely cheap. Our soldiers will need supplies, ships and a good wage, or this expedition will fail before it even begins.
Of course.
We shall engage in a bit of piracy, ourselves.
No, this is far too expensive.

Aware of my preparations, one of my vassals has asked for a little favor. Around the area that I planned to clean up, lives a tribe of natives. My vassal wants them dead, plain and simple. A sizable gift is ready for me if I happen to accept.
It would be my pleasure.
Get out of my sight.
All is ready. Time to eliminate everyone foolish enough to oppose the Black Network.
This trade route shall be ours.

I should have seen this coming: a rival nation is trying to disrupt our operations. Are the Harpers behind this interference? Hard to say at this point, but whatever the case, we shall not let anyone stop us.
Hire more mercenaries.
I have a lot of contacts among their own merchants.
Time to contact our spies.
No further measures are needed. I think?
Our enemies are not brave enough to challenge us in battle openly. Instead, they harry our expeditionary force with guerrilla tactics.
I know how to deal with those worms.
Is my marshal slacking off?
Everything is fine...
One of my vassals is reminding me of the promise I made to destroy one of the local tribes.
Some promises are meant to be broken.
We will eradicate them. Eventually.
Sigh. Hire more mercs.
Ambush! Our enemies have banded together and our convoy is under attack. This skirmish will determine the fate of this expedition.
They have already lost.
Bow to the Zhentarim, you dogs!
Fight on!
We have crushed our pathetic opponents, and now the flag of the Black Network proudly flies over every caravan crossing our new route.
It's just business.
My marshal is eyeing my new wealth with poorly concealed interest. Should I share it?
Well, it is fair.
Ha! No way.
Our expeditionary force was forced to retreat. My plans have been foiled, for the foreseeable future.
Curses!

Greetings, [Root.GetTitledFirstName].\n Our humble realm is in dire need of protection. As a loyal member of the Black Network, I'll pledge myself to you, so we'll be able to help each other in our future wars.
Excellent!
The gold will be confiscated, but how?
Let's see...
failure
Low increase of revolt risk, halved income for 5 years.
High increase of revolt risk, reduced income for 5 years.
Reduced income for 10 years.
Sneaky Taxation
The local peasantry has been forced to pay taxes in advance.
Ruthless Taxation
The local peasantry has been forcefully stripped of almost all wealth.
Bold Thieves
Thieves are very active in this province, and they have successfully pulled some high value heists.
Doing this is viewed as tyrannical by the faint of heart, and will lower their opinion of you by -10!
Has not used this decision before
Has not used the decision in the last 30 years
Open Zhent
This character is an open member of the Black Network.
Blasphemous Pretender
This character is working to achieve leadership over the Black Network, and openly refused to align themselves with both the Banite and Cyricist factions.

Greetings, [Root.GetTitledFirstName].\n [elimination_target.GetFirstName] is suspected to be a member of the [elimination_target.Society.GetName], operating from within your own lands. We would like to have this hostile interloper eliminated or neutralized, as you see fit.
With [From.GetFirstName] out of the way, your enemies' capability to interfere with your internal affairs is greatly reduced. The Dread Lords will be pleased.
One less threat to the Black Network.

A promising agent of the [invited_lodge_soldier.Society.GetName], [invited_lodge_soldier.GetFirstName], is offering [invited_lodge_soldier.GetHerHis] services, eager for a share of battle and profit. Such agents are often well versed in intrigue and warfare, and they usually have some kind of adventuring or mercenary background.
Good! And I already know who to replace...
column3: Bien ! Et je sais déjà qui remplacer...
column4: Gut! Ich weiß auch schon, wen ich ersetze...
column6: ¡Bien! Y ya sé a quién reemplazará…

column2: I expect great things from you, [invited_lodge_soldier.GetFirstName].
column3: Je m'attends à de grandes choses de votre part, [invited_lodge_soldier.GetFirstName].

column2: Welcome, friend.

Your marshal comes to see you one afternoon. Apparently, many merchants are reporting a new, extremely convenient trade route near your realm. The route would be highly profitable, but it seems to be infested by monsters and other unpleasantries.
All is ready. Time to eliminate everyone foolish enough to oppose the [Root.Society.GetName].
I should have seen this coming: a rival nation is trying to disrupt our operations. Who's behind this interference? Hard to say at this point, but whatever the case, we shall not let anyone stop us.
Bow to the [Root.Society.GetName], you dogs!
We have crushed our pathetic opponents, and now the banner of the [Root.Society.GetName] proudly flies over every caravan crossing our new route.
Storm Rune

The Storm Rune is a merchant cabal that operates in the city of Stormhelm in Eskorn. Members of the Storm Rune, merchants and landlords who meet in secret and keep their identities hidden from the lower-ranking members, work together to increase their wealth and status. They never commit violent or overtly unlawful deeds, taking care to avoid being noticed by the public eye. They normally employ spies, mercenaries, and intermediaries to advance their agendas.
A board of Directors stands at the top of the Storm Rune, always striving to maximize their profits.
Agent
Intermediary
Shareholder
Director
Agent
Intermediary
Shareholder
Director
Credit
Agents have no real power in the Rune, and are expected to follow orders.
Intermediaries handle the Rune's agents, following the higher-ups' directives.
Shareholders have proven their worth to the organization and are free to pursue wealth as they wish.
A board of Directors stands at the top of the Storm Rune, always striving to maximize their profits.

Greetings, friend, it is my understanding that you enjoy wealth. Our circle of friends does, as well, and we don't much care what happens to people that stand in the way of making our members more prosperous. Care to join us?
I'll fit right in.
Allied Merchants
The Collect Taxes steward mission is more effective.
With [From.GetFirstName] out of the way, your enemies' capability to interfere with your business is greatly reduced. The Directors will be pleased.
Good riddance.
Tsui Tong

A powerful criminal organization with thousands of members, the Tsui Tong ('Hall of Vice') began as a secret society dedicated to overthrowing a corrupt warlord. In this, they were aided by the hero Wo Mei. But in later years, the Tsui became corrupt themselves, engaging in robbery, murder, extortion and terror.
The Dragon Lord of the Tsui Tong is in overall control of the syndicate's vast apparatus for gathering coin and intelligence.

Harmony
Blue Lanterns are aspiring members of the Tong, who must show their worth to the organisation to progress.
Red Poles are the Tong's enforcers, responsible for military and paramilitary activities.
Incense Masters are overseers of the Tong's ritual and religious aspects, and conduct initiations.
The Tiger Generals are the leaders of the Tsui Tong's enforcer sections, the ch'eng po.

The Immortals bless many kinds of enterprise. I represent a powerful social organisation which can help them bless you with wealth and power, if you are ready to take risks and pledge your loyalty. Are you in?
Let the sacrificial banknotes be prepared.
Blackmail Proficiency
The Scheme spymaster mission is more effective.
With [From.GetFirstName] out of the way, your enemies' capability to interfere with our plans is greatly reduced. The Tiger Generals will be pleased.
No mercy for traitors.
Warlock Knights

The Warlock Knights, also called the Warlock Knights of Vaasa, are known for their brutality and for their aspirations of conquest. The Knights draw their power from from an otherworldly entity they call Telos. Warlock Knights are expected to be skilled warriors first and foremost, but all are also required to have some aptitude for arcane magic.
The Voice of Telos is the mysterious political and religious leader of the Warlock Knights.
Recruit
Knight
Knight-Vindicator
Knight-Councilor
Recruit
Knight
Knight-Vindicator
Knight-Councillor
Telos' Favor
Recruits are the newest members of the Knights. They most likely have much to learn.
Knights are regular members of the Warlock Knights of Vaasa.
Knight-Vindicators are powerful warlock knights to whom lesser ranked knights swear their allegiance.
Knight-Councilors are members of the Ironfell Council, the undisputed pinnacle of the Knights' hierarchy.

Great Telos sleeps under the desolate Vaasan tundra, and from there, he grants us power. It is our duty to rule the lands above his resting place with an iron fist: so said the Voice of Telos, and so it shall be. The entire world shall quake in fear of our might.
So it shall be.
Open Warlock Knight
This character is an open member of the Warlock Knights of Vaasa.
With [From.GetFirstName] out of the way, your enemies' capability to interfere with our organization is greatly reduced. The Ironfell Council will be pleased.
No one can stop us.
